conclusion: There are four objects positioned above a surface, and the light source casts shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Moving the light source closer to the objects will change the angle of the light rays.
Shadows will become larger because the light rays are more spread out when the light source is closer.
The shadows will move closer to the objects since the light source is now closer.
Position: Shadows will shift closer to the objects. Size: Shadows will increase in size.
